docs.title: Who we are
docs.text: We are group of Software Engineers who like to write useful code. We believe that software development should be as clear as possible.

docs.title: Our technology stack
docs.text: We try to resolve issues using suitable tools. There is our technology stack.

docs.title: Our working process
docs.text: We tried to describe our software development process in as much detail as possible. This should help you understand how we work.

docs.title: Application
docs.text: Performs business logic. It is part of the domain.

docs.title: Build
docs.text: Specific version of the application. It is part of the version.

docs.title: Domain
docs.text: Encapsulates the domain area of the system. The domain contains set of applications. It is part of the system.

docs.title: Release
docs.text: Specific version of the system. The release contains set of builds.

docs.title: System
docs.text: Final solution delivered to the client. The system contains set of domains.

docs.title: Software Engineer
docs.text: Implements and deliveres user stories and bug fixes to the client.

docs.title: Activities
docs.text:
• Create feature branch for User story.
  • Create bug branch for Bug.
  • Write code and tests.
  • Create pull request for User story.
  • Create pull request for Bug.
  • Review code and tests written by other Software Engineers.
  • Create Release.
  • Deploy Release.

docs.title: Sprint
docs.text: Sprint is fixed-duration timebox during which Team members deliver value to Customer.

docs.title: Release
docs.text: Release entity helps monitor current state of value delivery.

docs.title: Release workflow
docs.text:
stateDiagram-v2
  [*] --> Created
  Created --> Accumulating
  Accumulating --> Accumulated
  Accumulated --> Building
  Building --> ReadyForTesting
  ReadyForTesting --> Testing
  Testing --> ReadyForRelease
  ReadyForRelease --> Release
  Release --> Released
  Release --> Declined
  Released --> [*]
  Declined --> [*]

docs.title: Epic
docs.text: Epic is set of User stories and Bugs releated to completed functionality delivered to Customer.

docs.title: Epic workflow
docs.text:
stateDiagram-v2
  [*] --> Created
  Created --> Groomed
  Groomed --> Planned
  Planned --> InProgress
  InProgress --> Released
  InProgress --> Declined
  Released --> [*]
  Declined --> [*]

docs.title: User story
docs.text: User story is unit of value delivered to Customer.

docs.title: User story workflow
docs.text:
stateDiagram-v2
  [*] --> Created
  Created --> Groomed
  Groomed --> Planned
  Planned --> Coding
  Coding --> CodeReview
  CodeReview --> ReadyForTesting
  ReadyForTesting --> Testing
  Testing --> Release
  Release --> Released
  Release --> Declined
  Released --> [*]
  Declined --> [*]

docs.title: Bug
docs.text: Bug contains information about error in functionality and expected behavior after fixing the error.

docs.title: Bug workflow
docs.text:
stateDiagram-v2
  [*] --> Created
  Created --> Groomed
  Groomed --> Planned
  Planned --> Coding
  Coding --> CodeReview
  CodeReview --> ReadyForTesting
  ReadyForTesting --> Testing
  Testing --> Release
  Release --> Released
  Release --> Declined
  Released --> [*]
  Declined --> [*]

• Dart
  • Golang
  • Python

docs.text: • Flutter
